diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Fertile eunuch syndrome due to idiopathic hypogonadotropic hypogonadism
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was made based on clinical features such as eunuchoidal body proportions, low testosterone levels, and the presence of normal-sized testicles with some degree of spermatogenesis. Genetic testing revealed a homozygous mutation (Gln106Arg) in the gonadotropin-releasing hormone receptor, providing the genetic basis for the diagnosis. Follow-up therapy with hCG led to increased testosterone levels and subsequent sperm production, which supported the diagnosis of reversible hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
